message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.CYBER, cs.CR 

The paper focuses on developing a novel text analysis approach for studying user identity and social roles on Twitter, which involves developing a new text distance metric and using data visualization techniques. This work falls under the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) as it deals with analyzing social networks and user behavior. Additionally, the paper also involves natural language processing techniques (cs.CL) and cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) as it deals with identifying and analyzing online trolls. The paper also touches upon the field of criminology (cs.CR) as it involves studying criminal behavior on social media. Finally, the paper also discusses the theoretical implications of their work, which could fall under the sub-category of Sociology (cs.SOC).
